accessibility.text: Why?
ï¿¼
Inflation does no special harm to the poor
Why?
ï¿¼
During inflationary periods the prices paid by the poor rise neither faster nor slower than the prices paid by the rest of us.
Inflation does no special harm to the poor
Why?
ï¿¼
Inflation does no special harm to the poor
Why?
ï¿¼
During inflationary periods the prices paid by the poor rise neither faster nor slower than the prices paid by the rest of us.
Inflation does not raise the incomes of the rich relative to those of the poor
The opposite is true: Real incomes at the bottom rise relative to those at the top, making income distribution slightly more equal.
Inflation does no special harm to the poor
Why?

During inflationary periods the prices paid by the poor rise neither faster nor slower than the prices paid by the rest of us.
Inflation does not raise the incomes of the rich relative to those of the poor
The opposite is true: Real incomes at the bottom rise relative to those at the top, making income distribution slightly more equal.
Inflation does no special harm to the poor
